intro: Malope stipulacea var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers during the summer months. It is often found in coastal dunes and other dry, open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
